items.title: [Figma] Card in card

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

items.body:
Add the `Card in card` component to Figma kit. Remember we are only building variants for `xlg`, `md`, and `sm`.

[Design specs](https://ibm.ent.box.com/folder/132489332751?s=jad2fd65p56odcme9aoy1lgmuo1xaifu)
[Website](https://www.ibm.com/standards/carbon/components/cards#card-in-card)

**Must haves:**
- [ ] Content should be flexible - the designer should be able to condense or stretch the component and the content should respond. Removing text for example should maintain the right padding automatically through auto layout.
- [ ] Use the `Card - basic` component in this one.
- [ ] `Card in card` can have a video or an image in the background. Give designers the option to swap using variants. Image should be the default. Use any existing Image or Video components in this component.
- [ ] For the video version, the card content should use the video icon for the CTA (see the design specs).
- [ ] Should include all interactive states (Enabled, Hover, Active, Focus)

**Resources**
- C4IBM.com Component checklist is available in the Read Me ðŸ‘€ page of the Figma library
- [Bases demo](https://secure.video.ibm.com/channel/23570833/playlist/641336/video/131117161) from the Figma Fridays (Episode 23)
- Reference the [best practices](https://www.figma.com/file/8n9IJtHnICSydODoYl4ueW/Figma-Best-Practices?node-id=52%3A6706) from Figma guild
- Info on [auto layout](https://www.figma.com/proto/RQhu2NWQVr1JDaU4mpRuZh/Figma-Exercises?node-id=422%3A2366&scaling=min-zoom&page-id=52%3A6706&starting-point-node-id=422%3A2366)

items.title: [Figma] Card section offset

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

items.body:
Add `Card section offset` to Figma White theme kit.

**Must haves:**
- [ ] Use `Card - default` if possible.
- [ ] Use `Link with icon`.
- [ ] The heading is a fluid type - make sure to use the component version of the type if it exists or create a new version if it does not exist yet.
- [ ] Note that on `@sm`, the cards shift to below the image background and the cards stack.

![Screen Shot 2022-06-11 at 12.10.36 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/60b63c5c740eb13b3d18acb6/f5291fdd-3cdd-4a6c-9e42-ff79a87e07a4
)

items.title: [Figma] Card - Static

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

items.body:
Add the Card - static component to Figma kit. Remember we are only building variants for `xlg`, `md`, and `sm`.

[Design specs](https://ibm.ent.box.com/file/911782495148?s=hyuqbkgi43cij4reru3djh7ztmwp9vlp)
[Website](https://www.ibm.com/standards/carbon/components/cards#card)

**Pre work:** We need a way to swap icon for Link with icon. This might instead be built into the `Card - basic` component.

**Must haves:**
- [ ] Create a flexible base for the `Card - static` component, or use the `Card - basic` base.
- [ ] Should use `Link with icon` component
- [ ] Include variants with image, tags, eyebrow, and body copy. Note that these are all optional, so can appear with different options. Use variants to give designers the ability to toggle what is visible. Use auto layout to automatically set the correct padding.
- [ ] The [Storybook](https://www.ibm.com/standards/carbon/web-components/?path=/story/components-card--static)  has an option for `Outlined card` by default, which can be disabled to bring in a gray background. That should be a variant option.
- [ ] Designers should be able to resize the width and have the content condense. Check the specs and use auto layout to handle this.
- [ ] Only the CTA is interactive - make sure the `Card - static` component itself does not have interactive states.

![Screen Shot 2022-06-11 at 11.50.07 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/60b63c5c740eb13b3d18acb6/976219ef-3538-4a0d-bb43-95168714ef09)

**Resources**
- C4IBM.com Component checklist is available in the Read Me ðŸ‘€ page of the Figma library
- [Bases demo](https://secure.video.ibm.com/channel/23570833/playlist/641336/video/131117161) from the Figma Fridays (Episode 23)
- Reference the [best practices](https://www.figma.com/file/8n9IJtHnICSydODoYl4ueW/Figma-Best-Practices?node-id=52%3A6706) from Figma guild
- Info on [auto layout](https://www.figma.com/proto/RQhu2NWQVr1JDaU4mpRuZh/Figma-Exercises?node-id=422%3A2366&scaling=min-zoom&page-id=52%3A6706&starting-point-node-id=422%3A2366)

items.body:

With the latest update to `CTA - Feature` we need to update the `Feature card - medium` specs to display a variant for video. This includes:

1. Added variant with play button
2. Added timestamp to heading
3. Correct icon displayed (play) as the link icon.

items.title: [Figma] Card section

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

items.body:
Add the Card section component to Figma kit. Remember we are only building variants for `xlg`, `md`, and `sm`. 

[Design spec](https://ibm.ent.box.com/folder/99476973715?s=6prfrgt7dftdg47ejy3q3m4x7h47kbmo)
[Website](https://www.ibm.com/standards/carbon/components/card-section)

**Must haves:**
- [ ] Use `Card - basic` in the component, if able. If we can't, we should create a new card component for `Card section`.
- [ ] Either give designers option to scale from 2-9 card (max 8 cards + 1 CTA Card) or deliver the largest version and let designers delete unnecessary ones. 

- [ ] There are two main variants: Default or With CTA

- [ ] Use or create a `Card CTA` that uses an inverse color scheme. Ideally should use a Card CTA version that's the same as `Card group`
- [ ] Card section can include cards with images (does this include video?)

![Screen Shot 2022-06-11 at 12.00.38 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/60b63c5c740eb13b3d18acb6/63b50d67-2b82-4761-91ce-fc93f7163050)

![Screen Shot 2022-06-11 at 12.00.44 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/60b63c5c740eb13b3d18acb6/2f768865-44a9-4127-b076-26fd62f0f209
)

**Resources**
- C4IBM.com Component checklist is available in the Read Me ðŸ‘€ page of the Figma library
- [Bases demo](https://secure.video.ibm.com/channel/23570833/playlist/641336/video/131117161) from the Figma Fridays (Episode 23)
- Reference the [best practices](https://www.figma.com/file/8n9IJtHnICSydODoYl4ueW/Figma-Best-Practices?node-id=52%3A6706) from Figma guild
- Info on [auto layout](https://www.figma.com/proto/RQhu2NWQVr1JDaU4mpRuZh/Figma-Exercises?node-id=422%3A2366&scaling=min-zoom&page-id=52%3A6706&starting-point-node-id=422%3A2366)

items.title: [Figma] Card group

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

items.body:
Add the Card group component to Figma kit. Remember we are only building variants for `xlg`, `md`, and `sm`. 

[Storyboard](https://www.ibm.com/standards/carbon/web-components/?path=/story/components-card-group--default)
[Website](https://www.ibm.com/standards/carbon/components/card-group)

**Must haves:**
- [ ] Use `Card - basic` and other Card types (pictogram, etc) in the component, if able. If we can't, we should create a new card component for `Card group`.
- [ ] Include option to have image and video in each case (these can be on a card-by-card basis). Ideally, the designer can click into the card component and add it for each.But we need a variant option to turn on media for all cards.
- [ ] Include variants for 2 - 6 cards in a single Card group. Alternatively, build with 6 cards and allow designers to delete unnecessary ones.
- [ ] Can define how many cards per row: 2 - 4.
- [ ] Grid mode: Collapsed (1px), Narrow (16px), Outlined cards (1px border). This effects all the cards in the group.
- [ ] Toggle for Offset or not.
- [ ] Option to include CTA card. Use an existing component or create a new one from the Card _Base. Note that this is used in `CTA section`.
- [ ] A major variant includes `Card in card` above the card group. That should be a variant with the option to change whether Cards display media, grid mode as above, and total number of cards (2-6). Alternatively, build with 6 cards and allow designers to delete these.

**Default**
![Screen Shot 2022-06-11 at 11.57.05 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/60b63c5c740eb13b3d18acb6/ca0cef3e-379b-4493-8d76-3009658380ef)


**with card in card**
![Screen Shot 2022-06-11 at 11.57.22 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/60b63c5c740eb13b3d18acb6/104dbe10-a891-4b0f-9c71-519df5d0b1b6)


**Resources**
- C4IBM.com Component checklist is available in the Read Me ðŸ‘€ page of the Figma library
- [Bases demo](https://secure.video.ibm.com/channel/23570833/playlist/641336/video/131117161) from the Figma Fridays (Episode 23)
- Reference the [best practices](https://www.figma.com/file/8n9IJtHnICSydODoYl4ueW/Figma-Best-Practices?node-id=52%3A6706) from Figma guild
- Info on [auto layout](https://www.figma.com/proto/RQhu2NWQVr1JDaU4mpRuZh/Figma-Exercises?node-id=422%3A2366&scaling=min-zoom&page-id=52%3A6706&starting-point-node-id=422%3A2366)

items.title: [Card]  allow `target` attribute to card links

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

labels.name: icebox
labels.description: used for all issues in the Icebox pipeline.  Stalebot ignores these issues when this label is added.

items.body:
### The problem

Currently there is no way to open links into new tabs/windows.

### The solution

Provide access to the `target` attribute, either via component properties or add directly by authors (`target="_blank").

### Application/website

Carbon for IBM.com

### Business priority

Medium Priority = upcoming release but is not pressing

### What time frame would this ideally be needed by (if applicable)

_No response_

### Examples

For example:

`Card - with pictogram` here has no way to open links in a new tab or window.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/909118/136397680-726fbb55-ccbf-4eb3-a2f0-d3a21c374548.png)



### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/blob/master/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [X] I checked the [current issues](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues) for duplicate issues

### Additional Information
- [existing web standards documentation](https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/ibm-web-standards-external/standards-mandatory/page-layout-design)

items.title: [Card] HTML entities not displaying correctly in Card copy

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: Work necessary for the Carbon for IBM.com react components package

labels.name: severity 4
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, no workaround needed

labels.name: dev
labels.description: Needs some dev work

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

items.body:
### Description

When using HTML entities in the Card storybook knobs, they don't appear to be encoded correctly

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8265238/138314887-2c7bf986-9db4-487e-86a1-7d331f7bd840.png)

This may be a Storybook knobs issue with escaping HTML, but potentially related https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues/7469

### Component(s) impacted

Card

### Browser

_No response_

### Carbon for IBM.com version

canary

### Severity

Severity 3 = The problem is visible or noticeable to users but does not impede the usability or functionality. Affects minor functionality, has a workaround.

### Application/website

-

### Package

@carbon/ibmdotcom-react, @carbon/ibmdotcom-web-components

### CodeSandbox example

https://ibmdotcom-web-components-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/components-card--default

### Steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)

visit the [Web Components](https://ibmdotcom-web-components-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/components-card--default) or [React storybook](https://ibmdotcom-react-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/components-card--default)

try entering HTML entities in the story knobs


### Release date (if applicable)

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I checked the [current issues](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues) for duplicate issues

items.title: [Card - React]: Feature freeze

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: Work necessary for the Carbon for IBM.com react components package

labels.name: dev
labels.description: Needs some dev work

items.body:
### User story

> As a `[user role below]`:

IBM.com React developer

> I need to:

be aware that Card (in React) is in feature freeze

> so that I can:

switch to Card in web components for new types of Cards

### Additional information

- The engineering team decided to put `Card` in react into feature freeze. This means we will still support any bug fixes for `Card` in React, but will no longer support any new features or enhancements. We will need to direct users to the Web Component version.
- Documentation needs to be updated in the React README, as well as any storybook links to the wrapper version
- Add a note in the breaking changes documentation for React
- Add deprecation notice noting the feature freeze

### Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Deprecation notice noting the feature freeze added to `Card` in React
- [ ] Documentation added to the `Card` README regarding the feature freeze
- [ ] Added note under breaking changes for React about the feature freeze
- [ ] Any storybook links needed to point to the React wrapper version of `Card`

items.title: [Figma] Refactor Inverse card link in Feature section

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

items.body:
When prototyping `Feature section`, the Card link is presenting the default `Card link` hover states. This is because the inverse version is using a nested `Card link` which is overriding the prototype set. 

May need to create a separate base so the override doesn't happen


https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/193129061/b54daeaf-5041-495d-bc73-42236f2e4e73/card_link_bug_060822.mov

items.title: [card-pictogram]: screen reader output

labels.name: question
labels.description: Further information is requested

items.body:
### Summary

On desktop when reading card-pictogram with VO. Tabbing will read just the heading text and then using down arrow key will read the copy, but when using left and right arrow keys it still will not read the copy.

On mobile with VO the heading and copy are all read at once. 

Also, not seeing it read the pictogram label at all.

Browserstack screenreader only reads both heading and copy.

Wondering what info a user using VO should recieve from card-pictogram since it's slightly different from our other cards? 

### Relevant information

Previously, Ram has complained about cards being over verbose when reading heading and copy all at once

### Name and organization

Carbon for IBM.com

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/blob/main/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [X] I checked the [current issues](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues) for duplicate issues

items.title: Safari baseline: [Card static, Content group cards, Content block mixed, Carousel, Card section carousel] All cards' arrows moved right

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

items.body:
### Description

Card group with image, card section images (probably all card group variations with images) has a weird effect on android where the image disappears on first click and then if you click on the card again you can go to the link.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20210594/153954840-0efd5b15-2a89-4f2a-99c4-960e556593f0.mov



### Component(s) impacted

card groups with images

### Browser

Chrome

### Carbon for IBM.com version

1.31.0-rc.1

### Severity

Severity 3 = The problem is visible or noticeable to users but does not impede the usability or functionality. Affects minor functionality, has a workaround.

### Application/website

Carbon for ibm.com

### Package

@carbon/ibmdotcom-react

### CodeSandbox example

https://carbon-design-system.github.io/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/next/react/?path=/story/components-card-group--with-images

### Steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)

1. open on chrome android https://carbon-design-system.github.io/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/next/react/?path=/story/components-card-group--with-images
2. click on card

### Release date (if applicable)

_No response_

items.title: [Content group cards]: React â€“ VO differs from other card instances

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: package: react

labels.name: severity 4
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, no workaround needed

labels.name: dev
labels.description: Needs some dev work

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: Has accessibility requirement

items.body:
### Description

Voice over is reading Content group cards differently than other card components like Card group or Content block cards. Is this the expected behavior or should all cards be read the same way?

When in Content group cards, VO is announcing the beginning and end of a single card as a `group`. 

**Content group cards order:**
- Lorem ipsum group
- Heading level 3
- Lorem ipusum 
- Visited link, lorem ipsum
- end of, Lorem ipsum, group

Where as Card group or Content block cards does not announce a single card as a group and goes straight into the Heading.

**Card group / Content block card order:**
- Heading level 3
- Lorem ipusum 
- Visited link, lorem ipsum

**Video recording** (sorry you can hear me and not the VO)

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45692622/150403957-5aacfde7-b6be-4b02-92ac-02e728110809.mov

_This is present in Production_


### Component(s) impacted

Any component that uses content group cards 
â€“ Content group cards
â€“ Content block mixed

### Browser

Chrome

### Carbon for IBM.com version

1.30.0 rc 0

### Severity

Severity 4 = The problem is not visible to or noticeable to an average user. Affects minor functionality, no workaround needed.

### Application/website

Carbon for IBM.COM

### Package

@carbon/ibmdotcom-react

### CodeSandbox example

https://carbon-design-system.github.io/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/next/react/?path=/story/components-content-group-cards--default

### Steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)

_No response_

_No response_

items.title: [CTA]: Expose dds-link-list-item-cta and dds-link-list-item-card-cta in the SB variant preview

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

labels.name: adopter: AEM
labels.description: used when component or pattern will be used by this adopter

labels.name: owner:  Innovation Team
labels.description: used when the engineering work will be done by Hybrid Cloud with DDS engineers as consultants

items.body:
### The problem

- Currently within the `CTA` component there are variants/previews accounted for the following CTA components (see below)
  - Text
  - Button
  - Card
  - Card Link
  - Feature
![Screen Shot 2022-06-22 at 4 38 40 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1815714/175131928-8fa554b6-f156-430a-898c-4c90ad4f4ae7.png)
- However, there are no variants/previews constructed for `Link list item card CTA` and `Link list item CTA` despite the existence of these components.
  - https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/blob/main/packages/web-components/src/components/cta/link-list-item-card-cta.ts
  - https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/blob/main/packages/web-components/src/components/cta/link-list-item-cta.ts

### The solution

- I think it's important that we highlight these CTA components in the Storybook environment so that adopters like AEM can see how it's being used as we need to be able to define the CTA type within the CMS.
- Adjust the SB stories of the CTA component to account for the following components.
  - `Link list item card CTA`
  - `Link list item CTA` 

### Application/website

AEM

### Business priority

Low Priority = release date is not dependent on fix or not upcoming

### What time frame would this ideally be needed by (if applicable)

_No response_

### Examples

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/blob/main/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [X] I checked the [current issues](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues) for duplicate issues

items.body:
#### User Story
<!-- {{Provide a detailed description of the user's need here, but avoid any type of solutions}} -->
> As a `[user role below]`:
DDS Designer and Developer

> I need to:
test the `Card`

> so that I can:
be sure the developer's code correctly works as designed

#### Additional Information
- **See the Epic (#7631 ) for the Design and Functional specs information**
- Designer will be added as a reviewer to the Pull Request.  Visual QA reviewer will be notified by Github when review is needed.
- [Creating a QA bug](https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/603242247385)
- React Dev Issue (#7682 )
- Testing links provided in the Pull Request

 #### Tasks
Ensure the `Card` component has been tested and reviewed by design + dev.

#### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Pattern is reviewed by designer and design defects are identified
- [ ] New issues are opened to log individual defects
- [ ] Screenshots of as-is and to-be design should be added to the issue when needed
- [ ] Developer associated with building the pattern is assigned to the new issues
- [ ] Appropriate labels are added to the issue  eg.  bug, dev

items.title: [Card] React: Prod QA testing of FR to allow text link in all situations

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

labels.name: QA

items.body:
<!-- Avoid any type of solutions in this user story -->
<!-- replace _{{...}}_ with your own words or remove -->
#### User Story
<!-- {{Provide a detailed description of the user's need here, but avoid any type of solutions}} -->
> As a `[user role below]`:
developer using the ibm.com Library `Card`

> I need to:
have a version of the pattern or component that has been tested for accessibility compliance as well as on multiple browsers and platforms 

> so that I can:
be confident that my ibm.com web site users will have a good experience

#### Additional information
<!--  {{Please provide any additional information or resources for reference}} -->
- [Browser Stack link](https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/578734426612)
- [Browser Standard](https://w3.ibm.com/standards/web/browser/) 
- Browser versions to be tested:  Tier 1 browsers will be tested with defects created as Sev 1 or Sev 2.  Tier 2 browser defects will be created as Sev 3 defects.
- Platforms to be tested, by priority:  1)  Desktop  2)  Mobile
- Mobile iOS versions: 13.1, 13.3 and 14
- Mobile Android versions: 9.0 and 10
- Browsers to be tested:  Desktop: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, Mobile: Chrome, Safari, Samsung Internet, UC Browser, QQ Browser
- [Accessibility testing guidance](https://pages.github.ibm.com/IBMa/able/Test/verify/)
 - [Accessibility Checklist](https://www.ibm.com/able/guidelines/ci162/accessibility_checklist.html)
 - [Creating a QA bug](https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/603242247385)
- **See the Epic (#7631 ) for the Design and Functional specs information**
 - React Dev issue (#7682 ) 
- **Once development is finished the updated code is available on the 1) [WC Wrapper test env URL](https://ibmdotcom-web-components-react.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/*) or the [React canary environment](https://ibmdotcom-react-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/overview-getting-started--page) for testing.**

#### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Accessibility testing is complete.  Component is compliant.
- [ ] All browser versions are tested
- [ ] All operating systems are tested
- [ ] All devices are tested
- [ ] Defects are recorded

items.body:
#### User Story
<!-- {{Provide a detailed description of the user's need here, but avoid any type of solutions}} -->
> As a `[user role below]`:
Carbon for ibm.com developer

> I need to:
create/change the `Card`

> so that I can:
provide the ibm.com adopter developers components they can use to build ibm.com web pages

#### Additional information
<!--  {{Please provide any additional information or resources for reference}} -->
- Story within Storybook with corresponding knobs
- Utilize Carbon
- **See the Epic (#7631 ) for the Design and Functional specs information**
- This FR was created by Geo Pei.  They use react framework.
- WC dev issue (#7683 )
- React Visual QA testing issue (#7684 )
- Prod QA testing issue (#7686 )

#### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Built as a pure React component/variant
- [ ] Include README for the react component and corresponding styles
- [ ] Add any necessary stable selectors
- [ ] Create codesandbox example under `/packages/react/examples/codesandbox` and include in README
- [ ] Minimum 80% unit test coverage
- [ ] Update the Carbon for ibm.com website component [data file](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom-website/blob/master/src/data/components.json) to be sure the web site Component Status and Storybook links are correct
- [ ] Use the [Visual QA checklist](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/wiki/Definition-of-done-(Visual-QA-checklist)) to verify design quality
- [ ] Update the e2e test scripts, if needed. 
- [ ] Confirm e2e test results have no major errors.
- [ ] If a design is provided, the Designer is included as a Reviewer in the Pull Request
- [ ] Provide a direct link to the deploy preview for the designer in the Pull Request description
- [ ] A comment is posted in the Prod QA issue, tagging Praveen when development is finished
